title: robertcarlyle
author: robertcarlyle
content: If someone who is 43 maybe 44 years old in the u.s. has like at most 15 million usd worth of bitcoin, should they continue to work until theyre at least 62 years of age or can they just retire much earlier assuming they were either receiving annual dividends which were at least 300k usd per year or should they work until at least 50 years old to throw the towel?  How can it be determined when they should just stop working all together then?  Retire now or until theyre 50/62 years of age to enjoy their $$$?

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: If you have that amount of Bitcoins worth of 15m and you are the only one supporting yourself, why not retire at 44 years old? Since that amount is huge amount, I think a person can live with $44k annually, depending on where you live. The $300,000 is too much for an annual budget; I am not sure how you spend such a large amount unless you live with a family.

comments.author: Reatim
comments.body: Quote from: robertcarlyle on October 07, 2024, 12:04:29 AMIf someone who is 43 maybe 44 years old in the u.s. has like at most 15 million usd worth of bitcoin, should they continue to work until theyre at least 62 years of age or can they just retire much earlier assuming they were either receiving annual dividends which were at least 300k usd per year or should they work until at least 50 years old to throw the towel?  Personally I think this can do until retirement. Maybe because in my country, when I convert the numbers you just mentioned, it is huge and more than enough to sustain an entire family but in the US it might be so different since your living expenses are more expensive and will get just even more expensive. You would need to make sure that you can cover all things possible. Daily expenses, medical bills, or any emergency like the house burning down and if you have kids you would also need to make sure that they already have graduated or else you would also need to cover educational bills until they are. Only you can assess how much you are spending in a course of a year and whether what you have is enough to sustain you until your last day.  QuoteHow can it be determined when they should just stop working all together then?  Retire now or until theyre 50/62 years of age to enjoy their $$$? Again you are the only one who knows the extent of your situation. If you can still work and you are not experiencing any health concerns I think a year or two would not hurt. If you are not yet determined to retire then I think that is your answer.

However, i see a lot of people that get into retirement looks for different things to still be active in. Maybe you would get bored in the retirement life or something. Try pros and cons.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: robertcarlyle on October 07, 2024, 12:04:29 AMIf someone who is 43 maybe 44 years old in the u.s. has like at most 15 million usd worth of bitcoin, should they continue to work until theyre at least 62 years of age or can they just retire much earlierLife is very short and if you can be financially free, why don't you enjoy your life with good life quality as soon as possible?From 44 to 62 year-old, it's 28 years that equal to 8 Bitcoin market cycles. We know that historically each Bitcoin market cycle lasts for 4 years, that comes together with cycle of Bitcoin block subsidy halving. Satoshi Nakamoto set up the block subsidy halve after every 210,000 Bitcoin blocks that take about 4 years to happen.Times of 100x or 1000x for your investment in Bitcoin long gone and will not come back, so your investment ROI target must be much lower, like 4x, 5x. I believe that with 8 more market cycles, that ROI target will be achievable.Meanwhile, you can withdraw your profit gradually with time too, like the method of JayJuanGee.[ANN] JJG Sustainable Bitcoin Withdrawal Strategyhttps://bitcoindata.science/withdrawal-strategy

comments.author: Smack That Ace
comments.body: Even if you live in the United States, that's a huge amount of money and not everyone has that kind of money. I don't think a 43 year old with a $15 million net worth can't figure out their future and seek advice online. If it were me, I would go to my local lawyer or financial advisor for the best advice instead of going on forums or social media to seek advice from people who are still struggling with life. That is not a wise idea as it will make people more skeptical. I recommend you find a financial expert or advisor, they will give you the best advice you want to hear.

comments.body: Quote from: robertcarlyle on October 07, 2024, 12:04:29 AMIf someone who is 43 maybe 44 years old in the u.s. has like at most 15 million usd worth of bitcoin, should they continue to work until theyre at least 62 years of age or can they just retire much earlier assuming they were either receiving annual dividends which were at least 300k usd per year or should they work until at least 50 years old to throw the towel?  How can it be determined when they should just stop working all together then?  Retire now or until theyre 50/62 years of age to enjoy their $$$? It's a good challenge. But when deciding whether to retire now or wait? Well, there are some things worth considering, although $15 million is certainly enough to retire on. But the decision isn't just about the amount of money. But it also depends on how you want to live your life. What is your goal? And what are you doing? How does he want to maintain your lifestyle over time? If you earn $300,000 in taxes per year, that's stable income. But you are comfortable with the market fluctuations. Particularly if the bulk of your wealth is tied to Bitcoin or not, a multifaceted approach can help manage that risk.Another consideration is how you want to spend your time like do you love your job or do you want more freedom to travel, have hobbies, or pursue other activities? You can decide to stay active until age 50 just to build a larger buffer.A financial planner can therefore calculate how much you will actually need based on your expected lifestyle. However, bottom line, it is very important to balance your financial security and personal goals. Some are content with working a little longer for peace of mind. Some want to retire sooner and calibrate their living styles according to this objective. It is all about what comfort is most provided and what is granted most satisfaction.Quote from: Smack That Ace on October 07, 2024, 02:55:45 AMEven if you live in the United States, that's a huge amount of money and not everyone has that kind of money. I don't think a 43 year old with a $15 million net worth can't figure out their future and seek advice online. If it were me, I would go to my local lawyer or financial advisor for the best advice instead of going on forums or social media to seek advice from people who are still struggling with life. That is not a wise idea as it will make people more skeptical. I recommend you find a financial expert or advisor, they will give you the best advice you want to hear.You have good reason to seek professional advice. Especially if you are managing a large property like this. Financial advisors and lawyers can provide advice based on your individual circumstances. Tax implications and long-term financial goals, of course. However, I think it's also valuable to seek feedback in communities like this and where people can offer alternative perspectives or even share their own experiences.Of course, the expert financial advisor is invaluable, but the forums can offer insights or feedback that might help frame the questions you pose to those experts. In the end Getting professional advice to organize your finances At the same time, understanding that other people who are similarly situated, how do they guide their own decisions? Sometimes, it is a requirement to be open-minded and make decisions with the proper consideration of all the available alternatives before committing to making an important decision in life.

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: robertcarlyle on October 07, 2024, 02:49:36 AMWhat would 15 million usd at 3% dividends return be if not 600k usd annually? You can create an excel sheet and calculate it in two ways.15,000,000 as initial capital, and ROI is 3% annually, the profit will be 450,000 each year. In this case you can withdraw that profit each year and don't reinvest it.The second case is reinvest your profit, and you will need a formula for accumulative investment capital and ROI is 3% annually.After 1 year, you will have a new capital is 15,000,000+450,000 = 15,450,000 for the second year, and 3% of it is 463,500 for a second year.For a third year, you can continue this calculation, for both cumulative capital and profit.I don't know why you asked this question with an input of 3% ROI annually, it's unrealistic because Bitcoin has bullish and bearish years.https://charts.bitbo.io/yearly-candles/https://casebitcoin.com/

comments.author: Alpha Marine
comments.body: This is a decision that is entirely up to you. Every advice will be given from our perspective, we don't really know how your life is. We don't know if you're your only responsibility or a married man with kids and other family members to take care of. My point is, only you can answer that question for yourself.If I was the one with $15 million in BTC, I won't be thinking of retirement, maybe because I'm younger, but certainly because there's more money to be made. I'll still work, but not as hard. What's an early retirement anyway? I mean, you can be working and still have a very fun lifestyle. You never know how tomorrow will be. With that kind of money, you can have something that is not stressful and time consuming that'll still give you more money. It's totally up to you. People view life differently and no matter how absurd a thing might sound to one, that's exactly what another wants.
